benchmark_details.name: VIDHAL
benchmark_details.overview: VIDHAL is a benchmark specifically designed to evaluate video-based hallucinations in Vision Large Language Models (VLLMs). It features a diverse range of video instances annotated with captions exhibiting varying levels of hallucination.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating hallucinations in VLLMs using video data.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark uniquely focuses on video hallucinations, excluding text-only or image-only evaluation.

data.source: Public video understanding datasets including TempCompass, MVBench, Perception Test, and AutoEval-Video.
data.annotation: Captions that demonstrate varying levels of hallucinations.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on match rates between generated captions and ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in understanding and reducing hallucinations.
methodology.validation: Data was validated by human annotators to ensure reliability.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset respects user privacy and anonymity protocols.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data sourced from public datasets that allow for academic use.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The dataset conforms to relevant data usage regulations.
